subject: Technology
title: CNN and 24-Hour News
description: A short lesson to help you apply CNN and 24-Hour News.

hook.text: In 1980, Ted Turner launched a channel that only showed news, all day, every day. Critics called it crazy.

buildup.text: CNN was the first 24-hour news network. Before it, news came in 30-minute evening broadcasts and morning papers.

discovery.text: During the 1991 Gulf War, CNN broadcast live from Baghdad as bombs fell. It was the first war watched in real time worldwide.

twist.text: 24 hours of airtime needs filling. Networks turned to opinion, speculation, and sensationalism to keep viewers watching.

climax.text: Fox News and MSNBC followed, each targeting a political audience. News became entertainment, optimized for outrage.

punchline.text: 24-hour news was born to inform. It evolved to keep you angry and watching.

quiz.question: What challenge does 24-hour news face?
options: Filling airtime leads to opinion, speculation, and sensationalism
